**The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters of the Celestial Scripture**

**Scripture Title:** *The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters of the Celestial Scripture*. Also known as *The Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Red-Writ True Text*.

Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. It serves as the foremost scripture of the ancient *Numinous Treasure Canon*. Originally in two scrolls, later divided into three. Base text sourced from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Cavernous Perfection Division*, *Original Texts Category*. Collated with the Dunhuang manuscript S.5733.

---

**The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters of the Celestial Scripture, Scroll One**

In the East, the Azure Numinous Venerable of Anbao Hualin, styled *The Divine Life-Preserving Cavernous Mystery Chapter*.
In the South, the Cinnabar Numinous Venerable of Fanbao Changyang, styled *The Southern Clouds’ Celestial Numinous Mantle*.
At the Center, the Primordial Numinous Venerable of Yubao Yuanling, styled *The Precious Kalpa’s Cavernous Clarity Nine Heavens’ Numinous Scripture*.
In the West, the Radiant Numinous August Venerable of Qibao Jinmen, styled *The Golden Perfection’s Precious Luminous Cavernous Subtlety Chapter*.
In the North, the Mysterious Numinous Venerable of Dongyin Shuodan Yujue, styled *The Primordial Spirit’s Life-Generating Precious Luminous Text*.

The Five Venerables’ Jade Chapters are all spontaneously arisen texts of the Void Cavern, concealed within the Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace of the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Capital, the Purple Tenuity Palace, guarded by the divine officials of the Five Thearchs. According to the Mysterious Regulations, they emerge once every forty thousand kalpas.

*The Primordial Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Red-Writ Jade Chapters* originated prior to the Primordial Beginning, within the Void Cavern. Before Heaven and Earth took root, before the sun and moon shone, in the profound obscurity—without ancestor or lineage—the numinous writ flickered, now present, now absent. The Two Modes awaited it to divide; the Great Yang awaited it to illuminate. The numinous diagram revolutionized the cosmic course; the mysterious signs shifted and transmuted. Riding the moment, responding to the confluence, it thus came into being. Heaven and Earth received it and separated; the Three Luminaries received it and radiated. The numinous writ flourished in splendor, its cavernous luster ascending to the Highest Clarity, emerging from the Primordial Azure Heaven yet without fixed hue. Its textual form twisted and turned, beyond full comprehension.

The Primordial Beginning refined it in the Cavernous Yang Lodge, smelted it in the Flowing Fire Court, purifying its true text until it gleamed with radiance. As the Cavernous Yang qi was crimson, it was named the *Red Writ*. Once the numinous diagram shone forth, the myriad thearchs paid homage to the Perfected, soaring through the Void, circumambulating the Upper Palace, burning incense, scattering blossoms, and chanting the numinous chapters. At that time, twelve mysterious omens descended from Heaven, and twenty-four responses arose from Earth. Above, they celebrated the numinous mysteries of the Nine Heavens; below, they extolled the precious texts of the Three Heavens. The divine winds stirred, the August Dao flowed unimpeded. The Primordial Beginning issued the decree; the Supreme Perfected held the brush. The Jade Consort swept the mat; golden slips were cast, and the Jade Chapters inscribed. The Five Venerables recorded them, concealing them within the Palace of the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Capital. Jade maidens tended the incense; the Grand Florescence held the napkins. Jade lads stood guard; jade steps led to the audience hall. The scripture of the Nine Heavens was not for ghosts or spirits to hear.

Heaven treasures it to attain floating transcendence; Earth conceals it to achieve tranquility. The Five Thearchs wield it to secure their dominion; the Three Luminaries ride it to ascend in brilliance. The loftiest sages uphold it to attain Perfection; the Five Marchmounts follow it to gain numinosity. The Son of Heaven obtains it to govern; the dynastic mandate enjoys it to attain Great Peace. Truly, the wondrous power of the numinous writ is the mysterious root of Heaven and Earth. Its majestic numinosity expands boundlessly, pervading the vast transformations. It is the ancestor of the divine and luminous, its measure unfathomable, towering as the Great Void.

*The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters* emerged from the Void Cavern’s spontaneity, establishing Heaven and founding Earth, enlightening the divine and luminous. Above, it is called *Numinous*, stabilizing the Five Marchmounts and ensuring the nation’s enduring existence. Below, it is called *Precious*, its numinous treasure wondrous and mysterious, the most exalted of all things. The Primordial Beginning unfurled the diagram, above eliciting twelve numinous omens, below manifesting twenty-four responses.

1. At that time, there was neither Heaven nor Earth, only profound obscurity. The numinous writ flickered, without ancestor or lineage. The cosmic course turned of itself, becoming the root of the myriad qi. The Void Cavern congealed the Perfected; the qi clarified and ascended, forming the vast expanse of Heaven, suddenly and spontaneously arising from the Mysterious.
2. At that time, the Two Modes divided the Modes; the qi flowed downward and congealed, unfolding the profound and bearing the weight, all at once taking form.
3. At that time, thirty-six thousand suns and moons simultaneously shone, illuminating all Heavens, leaving no obscurity unpenetrated.
4. At that time, the loftiest sages, divine beings, and Perfected of wondrous conduct—innumerable multitudes—paid homage at the Jade Court, circumambulating the Great Void, extolling and reciting the numinous writ.
5. Heaven spontaneously produced divine music, a thousand myriad kinds sounding as one, resounding through the cloud palaces, celebrating the divine Perfected above.
6. Numinous winds sang in a hundred tones, spontaneously arising in the ten directions. The notes harmonized, all forming cavernous chapters.
7. The celestial pivot halted; the stellar lodges ceased their motion. Heaven knew neither day nor night; the four seasons dawned as one.
8. Purple clouds emitted radiance, streaming through all Heavens. All the myriad things universally received illumination.
9. Spring, autumn, winter, and summer knew neither scorching heat nor freezing cold. The four qi were gentle and harmonious; the withered and decayed all revived.
10. The Five Marchmounts stood firm. Talismans, diagrams, scriptures, and texts all unfolded at once, revealing the Mysterious Void and universally teaching the boundless.
11. At that time, seven treasures of divine marvels descended, scattering across the lands to nourish the multitudes.
12. Seven-jeweled wondrous groves spontaneously arose in the Void, their radiance shading and covering the Ten Heavens.

These twelve numinous omens spontaneously arose, the mysterious diagram initiating the cosmic course, manifesting the numinous writ. Earth produced twenty-four responses, celebrating the divine Perfected above.

1. At that time, the Heavenly qi was chaotic, without light. The dawn cock heralded the day; the four seasons shone clearly. The Mysterious Heaven unfolded; Earth expanded, giving rise to the Five Phases.
2. Thirty-six thousand suns and moons above and below shone with the same brilliance, illuminating the darkest nights without end.

3. Azure birds #1 bore missives in their beaks, announcing to the Five Thearchs to rectify the celestial divisions and degrees.
4. White tigers spewed forth gold, securely anchoring the Five Numinous Spirits.
5. Azure dragons presented talismans, reporting to the Water Thearch to regulate and hasten the cosmic course, opening the rivers and seas.
6. Jade dragons #2 bore imperial seals in their jaws, offering them to emperors and kings to stabilize the state, protect the throne, and ensure the Five Sacred Peaks endure forever.
7. Phoenixes sang and luan-birds cried, their soaring calls harmonious and resonant.
8. Flocks of birds soared and danced, their wings stirring the heavens’ edge.
9. Dragons leapt and frolicked, stirring the vast oceans and deep marshes.
10. The waters of the Yellow River stilled their flow, fish scales interlocking in assembly.
11. Sweet dew spontaneously arose, and magic mushrooms flourished in abundance.
12. Winter brought no frost or ice, and withered trees bloomed anew.
13. Forests, trees, and crops bore flowers and fruit in both winter and summer, their growth lush and unblemished, untouched by decay.
14. The Four Qi harmonized, calamities and epidemics ceased, heaven and humanity rejoiced, and none met untimely ends.
15. Venomous creatures sealed their fangs, harboring no harmful intent.
16. Lions and fierce beasts dwelled alongside humans as neighbors.
17. Throughout the world, the blind, deaf, lame, and infirm were all at once restored to wholeness, free from ailments, and enjoyed robust health.
18. The aged reverted to youth, the young never aged, their faces radiant and majestic, their spirits luminous and bright.
19. Birds, beasts, and the six livestock, whether pregnant or yet to conceive, all bore offspring without miscarriage or harm.
20. Pregnant women across the world gave birth to sons.
21. The earth’s hidden treasures were revealed, gold and jade exposed, scattered across the roads, leaving no secluded depths.
22. Heaven quaked and earth split, withered bones revived, sunken corpses and wandering souls arose as whole beings, and the world sang in celebration of the great peace.
23. The earth sprouted lotus blossoms, and heaven and humanity rejoiced, all filled with joy.
24. The Five Sacred Peaks opened wide, revealing talismanic scriptures to instruct heaven and humanity. At that time, all who studied attained flight as immortals.

These twenty-four responses extolled the numinous diagram of the Primordial Beginning, rejoicing in the enlightenment of the Five Elders. Once the numinous writ resounded, the Dao spread forth. Heaven and earth unfolded, the true Dharma flourished, the divine wind spread afar, and the myriad qi diffused their essence. The Five Thearchs lent their aid, guiding celestial immortals, commanding divine officials, and directing the movements of yin and yang. They secured the Three Luminaries in the Mysterious Root, preserved heaven and earth for eternal endurance, anchored the Five Sacred Peaks in the Numinous Abode, regulated the kalpic course at the Three Passes, established the state’s destiny in accord with the diagram, and guided the Five Qi to nurture the people. They propagated the Primordial Heaven’s greatness, universally teaching the ten directions. Their majestic power vast and boundless, no darkness remained unopened. The divine marvels were resplendent, beyond all description.

At that time, the Supreme Sage, the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Highest Heavens, and the Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions all rode upon five-colored jade wheels, jade carriages with azure canopies, nine-hued mysterious dragons, ten-fold feathered canopies, and three-pure streaming clouds. The Great Saints of the Heavens and the Perfected Ones of Wondrous Conduct all rode upon azure mists, nine-spirit flowing-light flying-cloud jade chariots. The Four Assemblies of the Empyrean, the Three Dawns exhaled fragrance, flying incense converged from eight directions, lightning flashed and beacons flared, floral essences bathed the sun, the Three Luminaries merged their brilliance, divine radiance blazed resplendently, and their glances traversed the Great Void. Following them were the Five Thearchs and divine immortals, the thousand Perfected of the Mulberry Grove, lions, white cranes, tigers, leopards, dragons, and unicorns. Divine consorts scattered blossoms, golden lads wafted incense, the Five Paths opened their roads, the Three Realms unsealed their ferries. They roamed the cloud paths, whistling commands to the Ten Heavens.

Ascending to the Supreme Clarity’s Great Mysterious Jade Capital, the Cold Numinous Cinnabar Palace, and the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, they donned the Heavenly Treasure Feathered Robes and proceeded to the Golden Gates of the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, beseeching to receive the *Primordial Beginning Numinous Treasure Red Writ Jade Chapters of the True Writ*. Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy commanded the assembly of Perfected Ones to enter the Golden Terrace Jade Treasure Palace of the Great Void, the Nine-Light Radiant Chamber. Jade lads and maidens attended to left and right, numbering ninety million. Flying dragons and venomous beasts guarded the eight gates, coiling serpents struck swords, long-fanged creatures clashed bells, divine tigers roared aloft, lions roared below, unicorns danced, phoenixes sang, their harmonious cries resonant. Heavenly chimes played their celestial melodies, jade tones echoed through the cloud courts.

The Supreme Elders and the Most High Lord of the Great Dao bowed their heads and spoke: “We humbly hear that the Primordial Beginning has renewed the cosmic course, the mysterious signs have unfolded the diagram, the numinous writ flourishes, and the divine manifestations grace the Five Directions. Heaven and earth rely upon it to part and take form; the Three Luminaries follow it to shine forth. This is the great enterprise of the primordial lineage—might we briefly glimpse its numinous depths?”

“Your servants, though unworthy, were born before the heavens of this kalpa, planted their truth within the Nine Numinous Palaces during the great kalpa, imbibed the essence at the Pass of the Five Flowers, received life within the womb of mysterious conception, beheld the yang within the dark stirrings of the soul, cast off the bonds of the Great Void, strode the long ferries, shone resplendent in the Three Assemblies, bathed in the radiance of the Supreme Mystery, flowed their light through the capital of Dark Florescence, and held fast to their aspirations within the Eight Circles. We presumptuously received the office of Enlightenment, and undeservedly became disciples of the Mysterious Master’s lineage. We reflect upon the multitudes of beings, grieving as the kalpic course flows onward. Now that the August Dao has flourished, the truth also moves in hidden ways. Our private hope is to extend the cloud’s shade to the eight distant realms, scatter the wind’s fragrance upon the orchid groves, let withered branches aspire to the luxuriance of the Florescence Yang, and let decayed bones receive the numinous essence’s ferry. Might we be granted a sight of the *Numinous Treasure Five-Chapter Jade Writ* and receive its teachings to instruct those yet unenlightened?”

The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, then absorbed in distant contemplation, stroked the table and raised his gaze. He summoned the Five Thearchs to deliberate upon yin and yang, reckon the kalpic cycles, shift the Yellow River’s source, inspect the celestial degrees, select the seed-people, point toward the Great Void, and whistle the Nine Mysteries into clarity. For a long while, he remained deaf to entreaties, sealing the path of those who sought the truth. The Most High Lord of the Dao persisted in his inquiry, until at last the Primordial Beginning cast a sidelong glance and, sighing deeply, said: “How subtle and profound! What you now ask—is it not too remote?”

This is the mysterious root of the Primordial Beginning, the scripture of the Empty Cavern’s spontaneity, preserving the kalpic movements within the celestial mechanism and anchoring the Five Numinous Ones to establish the true. Now, as the Three Heavens align their revolutions and the Six Heavens’ Dao unfolds, diverse teachings emerge to transform—there shall be thirty-six thousand kinds of Dao to liberate the minds of those yet to come. When this Dharma’s kalpa concludes, after the Three Dragons’ era, in the year of *gengzi*, when miscellaneous *qi* universally dissipates, our true Dao shall prevail.

For now, it may be entrusted to you, to be recorded in the Upper Palace, yet not yet disseminated to the lower world or taught to beginning learners. The Mysterious Statutes bear prohibitions; it may not be casually transmitted. You yourself may journey to the Numinous Capital’s Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, observe the celestial sounds inscribed on the golden tablets, and receive the postures from the Divine Kings. Thereafter, you shall be enabled to master the celestial patterns, thereby governing the Heaven of the Primordial Beginning.

Thereupon, the Most High Lord of the Great Dao and the assembly of perfected beings retired to fast for three months, then proceeded to the Numinous Capital Palace to receive the postures of reverence. Only then did they comprehend the precious solemnity of the Celestial Perfected, how difficult it was to immediately hear of them. Returning once more to the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, they consulted him on the rites of prohibition, humbly acknowledging their inadequacy. The Heavenly Countenance, moved by their discourse, unsealed the numinous barrier. He summoned the Five Elders and the Upper Perfected, who unfastened the cloud-brocade satchel woven of nine radiant, eight-hued mysteries, and produced the *Primordial Beginning’s Vermilion Writ Jade Chapters True Scripture of the Numinous Treasure*, entrusting it to the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, the August Jade Thearch on High, the Perfected of the Ten Directions, the Great Saints of the Myriad Heavens, and the Perfected Persons of Wondrous Conduct. They were instructed to transmit it in accordance with the Mysterious Statutes once the *qi* of the Six Heavens had dissipated, following the prescribed method.

*The Primordial Beginning’s Vermilion Writ Jade Chapters True Text*
The Upper Clarity’s spontaneous numinous writ, the Nine Heavens’ primordially engendered mysterious talisman, the Cavernous Void’s numinous verse. It establishes heaven and founds earth, unfolds the myriad perfected, pacifies spirits and anchors numina, engenders and completes the multitudes, rectifies and safeguards the celestial revolutions, preserves the heavens and ensures long life. Above, it governs the celestial mechanisms; at the center, it examines the Five Numinous; below, it strategizes with the earthly deities. Whistling commands the Yellow River’s source, moving and directing yin and yang, summoning spirits and dispatching immortals. This writ of utmost perfection wondrously responds to spontaneity, causing the heavens to ascend in clarity, the earth to stand firm in stability, the Five Marchmounts to be preserved and guarded, and the ten thousand kinds to abide therein.

The Primordial Beginning inscribed it upon the Divine Capital’s coiled writ, enduring through kalpas and revolutions, its text preserving the celestial root, never to be destroyed or lost. With the revolutions’ advance, it remains undefiled when mixed, grows clearer when defiled, indestructible when ruined, and supremely luminous when extinguished. This writ of Great Existence is revered by the celestial perfected, its true name self-luminous. The Thearch’s diagrams are engraved upon tablets, manifesting to future generations. The Five Elder Lords’ *Lingbao* Five Chapters of True Writ, the Celestial Writ of the Primordial Beginning, were born within the Void Cavern, serving as the root of heaven and earth. The Fourteen Virtues are all cultivated through the Three Origins’ fasts, their noble conduct renowned in lofty esteem.

First, their virtue is like the Great Void—formless and boundless, the ancestral origin of the beginningless.
Second, their virtue is like the Primordial Void—from nothing, something arises; within something, nothing returns.
Third, their virtue is like the Great Dao—majestic and numinous, vast and expansive, the treasure of divine luminosity.
Fourth, their virtue is like heaven—limpid, clear, lofty, and empty, broadly covering without bounds.
Fifth, their virtue is like earth—open, expansive, and all-embracing, bearing all without exception.
Sixth, their virtue is like the Three Luminaries and Five Planets—all heavens universally receive their radiance.
Seventh, their virtue is like the Lofty Perfected—expounding and unfolding the mysterious teachings, the honored ones amidst the heavens.
Eighth, their virtue is like the divine beings—broadly delivering all, universally receiving the natural.

Ninth, their virtue is like the Supreme Mystery—pure, open, and expansive, the capital of divine immortals.
Tenth, their virtue is like clouds and rain—all the myriad beings universally receive their shade and moisture.
Eleventh, their virtue is like the wind—all the myriad beings receive its bestowal and release.
Twelfth, their virtue is like the four seasons—all the myriad beings receive their generation and completion.
Thirteenth, their virtue is like Mount Tai—securing the primordial mandate, pacifying the divine regalia.
Fourteenth, their virtue is like the Great River—vast and unobstructed, none it does not embrace.

The numinous scriptures are wondrously weighty. These fourteen virtues, towering and lofty in their exemplarity, are of measureless magnitude. Their blessings flow like shade, endless through ten thousand kalpas; they illumine the primordial transformation, and none do not arise therefrom.

The Five Chapters of the Numinous Treasure’s true writ bestow fourteen blessings, and the rewards of blessings are as follows:

First, form and spirit become limpid and upright, free from all misfortunes; forever parted from pain and affliction, the body knows no illness.
Second, the myriad demons are subdued; the Five Emperors show reverence, earth spirits attend and guard, the heart is upright and the spirit settled.
Third, the lofty sages of the Mysterious observe; the heavenly spirits record one’s name, inscribe it in the register of the right, erase death and ascend to life.
Fourth, virtue and wisdom ever renew; ghosts and spirits are commanded, whatever one desires is attained, and one sits and summons the natural.
Fifth, divine youths and jade maidens attend and guard the body; wherever one goes, they receive and welcome.
Sixth, heavenly calamities submit; blessings and felicity daily increase, the household flourishes, and virtue daily ascends.
Seventh, the clan is upright and majestic; generation after generation enjoys peace, both within and without share in the felicity, and its blessings flow endlessly.
Eighth, the Five Emperors promote one; one is elevated to fill the ranks of the Perfected, the Three Realms receive and welcome, and a radiant light rests upon the crown.
Ninth, all dust and defilement vanish; within and without, one is bright and fresh, the body fragrant and pure, immaculate as vajra.
Tenth, no aspiration is unfulfilled, no wish unanswered; whatever one desires is effortlessly attained, boundless and penetrating, the heart keen and the body sagely, the spirit and the numinous in communion.
Eleventh, one is revered by all the great sacred honored gods of the heavens, the wondrously accomplished Perfected, the flying immortals of the Five Peaks, and all beings.
Twelfth, merit is perfected and virtue fulfilled; the Dao’s recompense is natural, the body grows feathered raiment, and one ascends to heaven in broad daylight.
Thirteenth, the greatness of one’s merit and virtue extends upward to seven generations of ancestors, liberating them from the Three Wretched Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties; they ascend to the heavenly halls, receive immortality in the Southern Palace, and blessings flow downward to descendants, generation after generation flourishing.
Fourteenth, the merit of these words extends to all crawling, flying, wriggling, and breathing creatures—both those already born and those yet to be born within the six domestic animals—all universally enjoy extended years. Those who honor the numinous writ, perform purification rites, and make offerings.

Such merit is of the utmost weight, and the recompense of virtue is natural. The Three Officials record and remember, not a hair’s breadth lost. The resonance of response and requital is most evident in principle.

The Middle Register of the Purple Tenuity Palace in the Mysterious Capital.

The true writ of the Numinous Treasure is beheld by the assembled Perfected who perform purification rites, uphold the precepts, and pay homage to the celestial writ with twelve devotions:

First, devotion to diligent and arduous practice, never transgressing the scriptural precepts, honoring the Dharma in every matter.
Second, devotion to the reverence of the Dao and the nobility of virtue, the loftiness and greatness of the Dharma’s transformation, and the aspirations of the heart.
Third, devotion to repenting and confessing all transgressions, hiding nothing, rectifying the heart and cultivating reverence, ever fulfilling one’s duties.
Fourth, devotion to the aspiration for divine immortality, to behold the True Lord, to escape the calamitous world, and to witness the Great Peace in person.
Fifth, devotion to delivering all from suffering and hardship, from the Three Evil Paths and the Five Calamities.
Sixth, devotion to the aspiration to attain flight, to ride upon clouds and dragons.
Seventh, devotion to the billions of ancestors, the parents of past lives, to disperse the accumulated burdens of the deceased, to free them from servitude and punishment, and to ascend to the halls of felicity.
Eighth, devotion to all within the household, young and old, and to fellow practitioners, that their blessings and felicity daily increase, and their good thoughts daily arise.
Ninth, devotion to all people universally, to descendants of future generations, that they escape calamity and, dwelling in peril, attain safety.
Tenth, devotion to all creatures from livestock downward, to all breathing and wriggling beings, and to all that draw breath and possess vitality, that they universally receive kindness and grace, and are covered and protected by beneficent shade.
Eleventh, devotion to the aspiration to transcend worldly glory, to cast aside heterodox customs, deceitful flattery, falsehood, demonic spirits, and the arts of spectral and miscellaneous sorcery.
Twelfth, devotion to commanding ghosts and employing spirits, to capturing and restraining the wicked and deceitful, that heaven and humanity suffer no harm, and all universally part from evil, the Three Calamities, Nine Perils, Ten Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, to attain the rank of the highest immortals, ascend to heaven in broad daylight, and after transcending the immortal realm, unite with the Dao in devotion.

These twelve devotions arise from the natural heart of heaven, the virtue of great compassion, and their merit is vast throughout the heavens.

chunks.original_text: 元始五老赤书玉篇真文天书经 经名：元始五老赤书玉篇真文天书经。 又名《洞玄灵宝赤书真文》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋。 系古《灵宝经》之首经。 原本二卷，后分作三卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞真部本文类。 参校本：敦煌S.5733号抄本。 元始五老赤书玉篇真文天书经卷上 东方安宝华林青灵始老，号曰《生神宝真洞玄章》。 南方梵宝昌阳丹灵真老，号曰《南云通天宝灵衿》。 中央玉宝元灵元老，号曰《宝劫洞清九天灵书》。 西方七宝金门皓灵皇老，号曰《金真宝明洞微篇》。 北方洞阴朔单郁绝五灵玄老，号曰《元神生真宝明文》。 五老玉篇，皆空洞自然之书，秘於九天灵都紫微宫七宝玄台，侍卫五帝神官，依玄科四万劫一出。 《元始洞玄灵宝赤书玉篇真文》，生於元始之先，空洞之中。 天地未根，日月未光，幽幽冥冥，无祖无宗，灵文晻蔼，乍存乍亡。 二仪待之以分，太阳待之以明。 灵图革运，玄象推迁，乘机应会，於是存焉。 天地得之而分判，三景得之而发光。 灵文郁秀，洞瑛上清，发乎始青之天而色无定方。 文势曲折，不可寻详。 元始炼之於洞阳之馆，冶之於流火之庭，鲜其正文，莹发光芒，洞阳气赤，故号赤书。 灵图既焕，万帝朝真，飞空步虚，旋行上宫，烧香散华，口咏灵章。 是时天降十二玄瑞，地发二十四应，上庆九天之灵奥，下赞三天之宝文。 神风既鼓，皇道咸畅，元始登命，太真按笔，玉妃拂筵，铸金为简，刻书玉篇，五老掌录，秘於九天灵都之宫。 玉女典香，太华执巾，玉童侍卫，玉陛朝轩，九天上书，非鬼神所闻。 天宝之以致浮，地秘之以致安，五帝掌之以得镇，三光乘之以高明，上圣奉之以致真，五岳从之以得灵，天子得之以致治，国祚享之以太平。 寔灵文之妙德，乃天地之玄根。 威灵恢廓，普加无穷，荡荡大化，为神明之宗。 其量莫测，巍巍乎太空。 《元始五老赤书玉篇》，出於空洞自然之中，生天立地，开化神明。 上谓之灵，施镇五岳，安国长存，下谓之宝，灵宝玄妙，为万物之尊。 元始开图，上启十二灵瑞，下发二十四应。 一者是时无天无地，幽幽冥冥，灵文晻蔼，无有祖宗，运推自来，为万气之根，空洞结真，气清高澄，成天广覆，倏 欻自玄。 二者是时二象分仪，气流下凝，开张厚载，一时成形。 三者是时三万六千日月一时同明，照曜诸天，无幽不彻。 四者是时上圣大神，妙行真人，无鞅数众，朝礼玉庭，旋行太虚，赞诵灵文。 五者天发自然妓乐，千百万种一时同作，激朗云宫，上庆神真。 六者灵风百咏，空生十方，官商相和，皆成洞章。 七者璇玑停关，星宿不行，天无昼夜，四运齐晨。 八者紫云吐晖，流洒诸天，一切万物，普受光明。 九者春秋冬夏，不暑不冰，四气柔和，枯朽皆生。 十者五镇安立，符图经文，一时开张，表见玄虚，普教无穷。 十一者是时悬下七宝神奇，以散诸地，资生兆民。 十二者七宝奇林，一时空生光明，垂荫弥覆十天。 其十二灵瑞，空生自然，玄图肇运，表明灵文。 地发二十四应，上庆神真。 一者是时天气混沌，未有光明，晨鸡启旦，四景朗清，天玄地张，成生五行。 二者三万六千日月，於上下同光明，向幽夜照曜无穷。

**Scripture Title:** *The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters of the Celestial Scripture*. Also known as *The Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Red-Writ True Text*.

Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. It serves as the foremost scripture of the ancient *Numinous Treasure Canon*. Originally in two scrolls, later divided into three. Base text sourced from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Cavernous Perfection Division*, *Original Texts Category*. Collated with the Dunhuang manuscript S.5733.

---

**The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters of the Celestial Scripture, Scroll One**

In the East, the Azure Numinous Venerable of Anbao Hualin, styled *The Divine Life-Preserving Cavernous Mystery Chapter*.
In the South, the Cinnabar Numinous Venerable of Fanbao Changyang, styled *The Southern Clouds’ Celestial Numinous Mantle*.
At the Center, the Primordial Numinous Venerable of Yubao Yuanling, styled *The Precious Kalpa’s Cavernous Clarity Nine Heavens’ Numinous Scripture*.
In the West, the Radiant Numinous August Venerable of Qibao Jinmen, styled *The Golden Perfection’s Precious Luminous Cavernous Subtlety Chapter*.
In the North, the Mysterious Numinous Venerable of Dongyin Shuodan Yujue, styled *The Primordial Spirit’s Life-Generating Precious Luminous Text*.

The Five Venerables’ Jade Chapters are all spontaneously arisen texts of the Void Cavern, concealed within the Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace of the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Capital, the Purple Tenuity Palace, guarded by the divine officials of the Five Thearchs. According to the Mysterious Regulations, they emerge once every forty thousand kalpas.

*The Primordial Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Red-Writ Jade Chapters* originated prior to the Primordial Beginning, within the Void Cavern. Before Heaven and Earth took root, before the sun and moon shone, in the profound obscurity—without ancestor or lineage—the numinous writ flickered, now present, now absent. The Two Modes awaited it to divide; the Great Yang awaited it to illuminate. The numinous diagram revolutionized the cosmic course; the mysterious signs shifted and transmuted. Riding the moment, responding to the confluence, it thus came into being. Heaven and Earth received it and separated; the Three Luminaries received it and radiated. The numinous writ flourished in splendor, its cavernous luster ascending to the Highest Clarity, emerging from the Primordial Azure Heaven yet without fixed hue. Its textual form twisted and turned, beyond full comprehension.

The Primordial Beginning refined it in the Cavernous Yang Lodge, smelted it in the Flowing Fire Court, purifying its true text until it gleamed with radiance. As the Cavernous Yang qi was crimson, it was named the *Red Writ*. Once the numinous diagram shone forth, the myriad thearchs paid homage to the Perfected, soaring through the Void, circumambulating the Upper Palace, burning incense, scattering blossoms, and chanting the numinous chapters. At that time, twelve mysterious omens descended from Heaven, and twenty-four responses arose from Earth. Above, they celebrated the numinous mysteries of the Nine Heavens; below, they extolled the precious texts of the Three Heavens. The divine winds stirred, the August Dao flowed unimpeded. The Primordial Beginning issued the decree; the Supreme Perfected held the brush. The Jade Consort swept the mat; golden slips were cast, and the Jade Chapters inscribed. The Five Venerables recorded them, concealing them within the Palace of the Nine Heavens’ Numinous Capital. Jade maidens tended the incense; the Grand Florescence held the napkins. Jade lads stood guard; jade steps led to the audience hall. The scripture of the Nine Heavens was not for ghosts or spirits to hear.

Heaven treasures it to attain floating transcendence; Earth conceals it to achieve tranquility. The Five Thearchs wield it to secure their dominion; the Three Luminaries ride it to ascend in brilliance. The loftiest sages uphold it to attain Perfection; the Five Marchmounts follow it to gain numinosity. The Son of Heaven obtains it to govern; the dynastic mandate enjoys it to attain Great Peace. Truly, the wondrous power of the numinous writ is the mysterious root of Heaven and Earth. Its majestic numinosity expands boundlessly, pervading the vast transformations. It is the ancestor of the divine and luminous, its measure unfathomable, towering as the Great Void.

*The Primordial Five Venerables’ Red-Writ Jade Chapters* emerged from the Void Cavern’s spontaneity, establishing Heaven and founding Earth, enlightening the divine and luminous. Above, it is called *Numinous*, stabilizing the Five Marchmounts and ensuring the nation’s enduring existence. Below, it is called *Precious*, its numinous treasure wondrous and mysterious, the most exalted of all things. The Primordial Beginning unfurled the diagram, above eliciting twelve numinous omens, below manifesting twenty-four responses.

1. At that time, there was neither Heaven nor Earth, only profound obscurity. The numinous writ flickered, without ancestor or lineage. The cosmic course turned of itself, becoming the root of the myriad qi. The Void Cavern congealed the Perfected; the qi clarified and ascended, forming the vast expanse of Heaven, suddenly and spontaneously arising from the Mysterious.
2. At that time, the Two Modes divided the Modes; the qi flowed downward and congealed, unfolding the profound and bearing the weight, all at once taking form.
3. At that time, thirty-six thousand suns and moons simultaneously shone, illuminating all Heavens, leaving no obscurity unpenetrated.
4. At that time, the loftiest sages, divine beings, and Perfected of wondrous conduct—innumerable multitudes—paid homage at the Jade Court, circumambulating the Great Void, extolling and reciting the numinous writ.
5. Heaven spontaneously produced divine music, a thousand myriad kinds sounding as one, resounding through the cloud palaces, celebrating the divine Perfected above.
6. Numinous winds sang in a hundred tones, spontaneously arising in the ten directions. The notes harmonized, all forming cavernous chapters.
7. The celestial pivot halted; the stellar lodges ceased their motion. Heaven knew neither day nor night; the four seasons dawned as one.
8. Purple clouds emitted radiance, streaming through all Heavens. All the myriad things universally received illumination.
9. Spring, autumn, winter, and summer knew neither scorching heat nor freezing cold. The four qi were gentle and harmonious; the withered and decayed all revived.
10. The Five Marchmounts stood firm. Talismans, diagrams, scriptures, and texts all unfolded at once, revealing the Mysterious Void and universally teaching the boundless.
11. At that time, seven treasures of divine marvels descended, scattering across the lands to nourish the multitudes.
12. Seven-jeweled wondrous groves spontaneously arose in the Void, their radiance shading and covering the Ten Heavens.

These twelve numinous omens spontaneously arose, the mysterious diagram initiating the cosmic course, manifesting the numinous writ. Earth produced twenty-four responses, celebrating the divine Perfected above.

chunks.original_text: 奉斋朝天真，万帝众神，诸天诸地，集算校大劫、小劫、大小百六天地运度，料别善恶，学道应得神仙人名。 其日遣上太一下。 上太一自下，其中诸天星辰日月璇玑北斗惨然俱下，与五帝五岳四渎江河淮济水帝九部刺奸，三官考召、地上神祇，周行天下，司察善恶功过轻重，列言上天。 其日有修奉灵宝真经，修斋戒，烧香念道，为太乙所举，列言善功，则名上仙簿，＠地神营护。 有违科犯戒，移名付地官，长为罪民。 太玄上宫北帝，常以庚申日，制天民三尸魂神，条人罪状，上奏帝君。 当此日，能修斋奉戒，昼夜思神，则三尸不得上天言人之罪，地司奏人善功，列言帝君，太一欢喜，即记名左契，长为种民。 太玄上宫至真尊神，常以甲子日，遣大一中台大使者下，周行诸天诸地，检校神祇，驱散杂俗鬼精。 当此日，能设斋烧香，中台大使者皆条善功，奏上三天上帝，上帝即除为监天，领地上鬼普神王者，书名玉历，长为真人。 太玄上宫高真大神，常以立春之日，会诸尊大圣仙人於太极上宫，算校玉札金名，应得神仙之人，列奏灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上官太．素真人，常以春分之日，会诸仙官於昆仑瑶台，校定灵宝真经学者，功业轻重，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上宫五帝，常以立夏之日，会诸仙人於紫微宫，校定学者功过，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上宫天上三官，常以夏至之日，会於司命上宫，校定兆民，算会簿录，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上宫五岳诸真人，常以立秋之日，上诣中黄老君於黄房灵庭，会诸仙官，检校天下神图灵药，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上官上皇大帝，常以秋分之日，上登上清灵阙太微之馆，会灵宝尊神、太上五老君、北极真公、八海大神，集算天下兆民罪录，功过轻重大小，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上宫阳台真人，常以立冬之日，会论仙官玉女於灵宝阳台之上，校学道簿录名目轻重深浅，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 太玄上宫天真众仙，常以冬至之日，上诣方诸束华青宫，会於束海青童金阙上相至真大神，校定众仙名录，列言灵宝玄都上宫。 八节之日，是上天八会大庆之日也。 其日诸天大圣尊神、妙行真人，莫不上会灵宝玄都玉京山上宫。 朝庆天真，奉戒持斋，旋行诵经，各遣天真威神，周行天下四海八极，五岳名山学人及得道兆庶，纠察功过轻重，列言上宫。 其日诸天星宿，日月璇玑，地上神祇莫不振肃。 凡是修斋持戒，宗奉天文，皆为五帝所举，上天右别，书名玉历，记为种民，告下三官神灵侍卫，门户整肃，万灾不干。 至学之士，三界司迎，神仙度世，上为真人。 为恶犯戒，司考所纠，移付地官，长为罪民。 五老灵宝五篇真文，元始天书，生於空洞之中，为天地之根，灵尊妙贵，法教威严。 三元开张，德冠诸天。 一十四德，皆以三元斋之，贵行标於高称。 一者其德如太空，无形荡荡，为无始之宗。 二者其德如虚元，无中生有，有中归无。 三者其德如大道，威灵恢廓，为神明之宝。 四者其德如天，澄清高虚，广覆无边。 五者其德如地，开张广纳，无毫不载。 六者其德如三光五曜，诸天普受光明。 七者其德如高真，敷演玄教，为天中之尊。 八者．其德如神人，广度一切，普受自然。

On the days of fasting and audience with the Heavenly Perfected, the Ten Thousand Thearchs and host of gods, all heavens and all earths assemble to tally and examine the great kalpas, lesser kalpas, and the cyclical revolutions of the One Hundred Six Heavens and Earths. They assess good and evil, and record the names of those who study the Dao and are destined to become divine immortals. On such days, the Supreme Grand Unity descends. As the Supreme Grand Unity descends, all the stellar constellations of the heavens—sun, moon, the Jade Armillary Sphere, and the Northern Dipper—grimly descend with it. Together with the Five Thearchs, the Five Marchmounts, the Four Waterways, the River Lords of the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji, and the Nine Divisions, they expose transgressions. The Three Officials summon and examine, while the terrestrial deities patrol the world, overseeing and scrutinizing the weight of good and evil deeds, then reporting them to the heavens. On such days, those who uphold the *Lingbao* True Scriptures, observe fasting and precepts, burn incense, and recite the Dao are commended by the Grand Unity. Their meritorious deeds are recorded, their names inscribed in the Registers of Transcendent Immortals, and the earth gods encamp to protect them. Those who violate the precepts and break the rules have their names transferred to the Earth Officials, forever marked as sinful subjects.

The Northern Thearch of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on every *gengshen* day, restrains the Three Worms and hun-souls of the celestial subjects, itemizing their transgressions and reporting them to the Imperial Lord. On such days, those who observe fasting and precepts, meditating on the divine day and night, prevent the Three Worms from ascending to heaven to report their sins. The Earthly Offices instead report their good deeds to the Imperial Lord. The Grand Unity rejoices and records their names in the Left Contract, forever marking them as the seed people.

The Supreme Perfected Honored Gods of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on every *jiazi* day, dispatch the Grand Unity’s Central Terrace Great Envoys to traverse all heavens and earths, inspecting the deities and driving away miscellaneous vulgar spirits and demonic essences. On such days, those who perform fasting rites and burn incense have their good deeds itemized by the Central Terrace Great Envoys and reported to the Three Heavens’ Supreme Thearch. The Supreme Thearch then appoints them as Overseers of Heaven, commanding the terrestrial ghost and spirit kings. Their names are inscribed in the Jade Calendar, and they are forever recognized as Perfected Ones.

The Lofty Perfected Great Gods of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), convene with the honored great sages and immortals in the Supreme Ultimate Upper Palace to tally the jade tablets and golden names of those destined to become divine immortals, reporting them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Supreme Mystery Upper Palace’s Primordial Perfected Ones, on the day of *Chunfen* (Spring Equinox), gather with the various immortal officials at the Jasper Terrace of Kunlun to assess and determine the merits of those who study the *Lingbao* True Scriptures, reporting the weight of their achievements to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Five Thearchs of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), convene with the various immortals in the Purple Tenuity Palace to assess the merits and transgressions of scholars, reporting them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Heavenly Three Officials of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Xiazhi* (Summer Solstice), assemble at the Upper Palace of the Controller of Destinies to assess and tally the records of the myriad people, reporting them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Various Perfected Ones of the Five Marchmounts of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn), ascend to the Yellow Chamber’s Numinous Court to meet with the Yellow Elder Lord and the various immortal officials. They inspect the divine charts and numinous medicines of the world, reporting them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Supreme August Thearch of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Qiufen* (Autumn Equinox), ascends to the Upper Clarity’s Numinous Watchtower and the Grand Tenuity’s Hall to convene with the *Lingbao* Honored Gods, the Supreme Five Elder Lords, the Northern Culmen Perfected Duke, and the Great Gods of the Eight Seas. They tally the records of transgressions of the world’s myriad people, assessing the weight of merits and transgressions, and report them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Yang Terrace Perfected Ones of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter), gather with the immortal officials and jade maidens atop the *Lingbao* Yang Terrace to assess the records of Dao students, weighing the depth and shallowness of their names, and report them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The Heavenly Perfected and Host of Immortals of the Supreme Mystery Upper Palace, on the day of *Dongzhi* (Winter Solstice), ascend to the Eastern Sea’s Azure Radiance Azure Palace to convene with the Eastern Sea’s Azure Lad and the Golden Watchtower’s Prime Minister, the Supreme Perfected Great Gods. They assess and determine the records of the host of immortals, reporting them to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis Upper Palace.

The days of the Eight Nodal Points are the great celebratory assembly days of the heavens. On such days, the great sagely honored gods and the wondrously accomplished Perfected Ones of the various heavens ascend without exception to the *Lingbao* Mystery Metropolis’ Jade Capital Mountain Upper Palace. They pay homage to the Heavenly Perfected, uphold the precepts and fast, circumambulate while reciting scriptures, and each dispatches the majestic divine spirits to patrol the world, the Four Seas, the Eight Extremities, the Five Marchmounts, and the famous mountains, scrutinizing the merits and transgressions of those who study the Dao and the common people who have attained it. The weight of their deeds is reported to the Upper Palace. On such days, the stellar constellations of the heavens, the sun, moon, Jade Armillary Sphere, and the terrestrial deities all stand in solemn reverence. All who observe fasting, uphold the precepts, and revere the celestial patterns are commended by the Five Thearchs, distinguished in the heavens’ right records, their names inscribed in the Jade Calendar. They are marked as the seed people, and the Three Officials’ divine spirits are commanded to guard and protect them. Their households are ordered and solemn, and the myriad calamities do not afflict them. Those who diligently study are welcomed by the Three Realms’ overseers, and the immortals deliver them to transcend the world, elevating them as Perfected Ones. Those who do evil and violate the precepts are seized by the examining officials, transferred to the Earth Officials, and forever marked as sinful subjects.

The Five Elder Lords’ *Lingbao* Five Chapters of True Writ, the Celestial Writ of the Primordial Beginning, were born within the Void Cavern, serving as the root of heaven and earth. Numinous, honored, and wondrously noble, their teachings are majestic and solemn. The Three Origins unfold, their virtue crowning all heavens. The Fourteen Virtues are all cultivated through the Three Origins’ fasts, their noble conduct renowned in lofty esteem.

First, their virtue is like the Great Void—formless and boundless, the ancestral origin of the beginningless.
Second, their virtue is like the Primordial Void—from nothing, something arises; within something, nothing returns.
Third, their virtue is like the Great Dao—majestic and numinous, vast and expansive, the treasure of divine luminosity.
Fourth, their virtue is like heaven—limpid, clear, lofty, and empty, broadly covering without bounds.

Seventh, their virtue is like the Lofty Perfected—expounding and unfolding the mysterious teachings, the honored ones amidst the heavens.
Eighth, their virtue is like the divine beings—broadly delivering all, universally receiving the natural.

chunks.original_text: 九者其德如太玄，清开广置为神仙之都。 十者其德如云雨，一切万物，普受其荫润。 十一者其德如风，一切万物受其施泄。 十二者其德如四时，一切万物，受其生成。 十三者其德如泰山，保固元祚，安宁神器。 十四者其德如大江，荡荡无碍，莫不开容。 灵文妙重，斯一十四德，其德如之巍巍高范，量难可胜，垂荫福流，万劫无穷，开明元化，莫不由焉。 灵宝五篇真文，施一十四福，福报如之。 一者形神澄正，不受众横，永离痛恼，身无疾病。 二者万魔降伏，五帝所敬，地祇侍卫，心端神定。 三者上圣玄监，天神记名，右别簿录，削死上生。 四者德慧长新，役使鬼神，举向所欲，坐招自然。 五者神童玉女，侍卫身形，出入游行，所在司迎。 六者天灾宾伏，福庆日臻，门户昌炽，道德日隆。 七者门族端伟，世世安宁，中外享庆，润流无穷。 八者五帝所举，上补真人，三界司迎，项负宝光。 九者尘垢普消，表裹明鲜，身香体洁，净如金刚。 十者志无不克，愿无不从，适意所欲，洞达无穷，心聪体圣，神明交通。 十一者为诸天大圣尊神、妙行真人、五岳飞仙，一切所宗。 十二者功成德满，道报自然，身生羽服，白日升天。 十三者功德之大，上延七祖，解脱三涂，五苦八难，上升天堂，受仙南宫，下流种孙，世世兴隆。 十四者功言一切蠢飞蜎息，已生未生门内六畜，普皆延年，宗奉灵文，修斋供养。 斯功至重，德报自然，三官记识，无失毫分。 影响相酬，其理甚明。 二篇德福二十八条，出玄都紫微宫上元格中，至真学者行之德也。 玄都紫微宫中元格。 灵宝真文，见众真修斋奉戒，朝礼天文，有一十二念。 一念精进苦行，不犯经戒，每事尊法。 二念道尊德贵，法化高大，心所希愿。 三念悔谢众罪，无所隐匿，整心修敬，每以尽节。 四念愿求神仙，得见真君，免度厄世，身睹太平。 五念度诸苦难，三恶之道，五灾之中。 六念愿得飞行，驾乘云龙。 七念为亿曾万祖，上世父母，宿考解散，免离徒责，上升福堂。 八念家中大小，同学之人，福庆日升，善念日生。 九念普为一切人民，后世子孙，厄中得免，居危获安。 十念畜牧已下、一切众生，蝖飞蠢动，及得喘息有生气者，普蒙惠泽，恩润覆护。 十一念志远荣华，奸祆杂俗，邪谄假伪，祆孽鬼神，精魅杂法之术。 十二念使鬼役神，收摄邪奸，天人无害，普离众恶，三灾九厄，十苦八难，克获上仙，白日升天，仙度之后，与道念同。 此一十二念，发自然天心，大慈之德，功懋诸天。 旧仪系灵宝中元篇目，在玄都宫。 玄都紫微官中元格，施一十二念，而有一十二报。 一者身体刚强，躯形安宁。 二者名声远着，一切之人，愿所欲闻。 三者为诸天大圣尊神、妙行真人所见爱敬，日月星宿所惠，仙圣所宗，地祇所仰，鬼神所畏。 四者世间万姓敬奉，称为真人，吉无不利，庆载永安。 一切蠢动，希为桥梁，千精万邪，妖伪鬼神，一时消灭，举响从心。 五者谓之所诣，出入行来，吏兵卫身，天官导从，地神奉迎。 六者制伏天地一切鬼神，坐致天厨玉女侍卫。 七者驱驰六甲，运走星辰，诃役三皇，走使鬼神，行来坐起，饮食卧息，天神侍护，地神直卫。 八者所在住止，方圆三千六百里中，妖伪杂俗，奸诈魍魉，一时消减。

Ninth, their virtue is like the Supreme Mystery—pure, open, and expansive, the capital of divine immortals.
Tenth, their virtue is like clouds and rain—all the myriad beings universally receive their shade and moisture.
Eleventh, their virtue is like the wind—all the myriad beings receive its bestowal and release.
Twelfth, their virtue is like the four seasons—all the myriad beings receive their generation and completion.
Thirteenth, their virtue is like Mount Tai—securing the primordial mandate, pacifying the divine regalia.
Fourteenth, their virtue is like the Great River—vast and unobstructed, none it does not embrace.

The numinous scriptures are wondrously weighty. These fourteen virtues, towering and lofty in their exemplarity, are of measureless magnitude. Their blessings flow like shade, endless through ten thousand kalpas; they illumine the primordial transformation, and none do not arise therefrom.

The Five Chapters of the Numinous Treasure’s true writ bestow fourteen blessings, and the rewards of blessings are as follows:

First, form and spirit become limpid and upright, free from all misfortunes; forever parted from pain and affliction, the body knows no illness.
Second, the myriad demons are subdued; the Five Emperors show reverence, earth spirits attend and guard, the heart is upright and the spirit settled.
Third, the lofty sages of the Mysterious observe; the heavenly spirits record one’s name, inscribe it in the register of the right, erase death and ascend to life.
Fourth, virtue and wisdom ever renew; ghosts and spirits are commanded, whatever one desires is attained, and one sits and summons the natural.
Fifth, divine youths and jade maidens attend and guard the body; wherever one goes, they receive and welcome.
Sixth, heavenly calamities submit; blessings and felicity daily increase, the household flourishes, and virtue daily ascends.
Seventh, the clan is upright and majestic; generation after generation enjoys peace, both within and without share in the felicity, and its blessings flow endlessly.
Eighth, the Five Emperors promote one; one is elevated to fill the ranks of the Perfected, the Three Realms receive and welcome, and a radiant light rests upon the crown.
Ninth, all dust and defilement vanish; within and without, one is bright and fresh, the body fragrant and pure, immaculate as vajra.
Tenth, no aspiration is unfulfilled, no wish unanswered; whatever one desires is effortlessly attained, boundless and penetrating, the heart keen and the body sagely, the spirit and the numinous in communion.
Eleventh, one is revered by all the great sacred honored gods of the heavens, the wondrously accomplished Perfected, the flying immortals of the Five Peaks, and all beings.
Twelfth, merit is perfected and virtue fulfilled; the Dao’s recompense is natural, the body grows feathered raiment, and one ascends to heaven in broad daylight.
Thirteenth, the greatness of one’s merit and virtue extends upward to seven generations of ancestors, liberating them from the Three Wretched Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Difficulties; they ascend to the heavenly halls, receive immortality in the Southern Palace, and blessings flow downward to descendants, generation after generation flourishing.
Fourteenth, the merit of these words extends to all crawling, flying, wriggling, and breathing creatures—both those already born and those yet to be born within the six domestic animals—all universally enjoy extended years. Those who honor the numinous writ, perform purification rites, and make offerings.

Such merit is of the utmost weight, and the recompense of virtue is natural. The Three Officials record and remember, not a hair’s breadth lost. The resonance of response and requital is most evident in principle.

The two chapters on virtue and blessings comprise twenty-eight clauses, issued from the Upper Register of the Purple Tenuity Palace in the Mysterious Capital. They are the virtues practiced by the most true and devoted scholars.

The Middle Register of the Purple Tenuity Palace in the Mysterious Capital.

The true writ of the Numinous Treasure is beheld by the assembled Perfected who perform purification rites, uphold the precepts, and pay homage to the celestial writ with twelve devotions:

First, devotion to diligent and arduous practice, never transgressing the scriptural precepts, honoring the Dharma in every matter.
Second, devotion to the reverence of the Dao and the nobility of virtue, the loftiness and greatness of the Dharma’s transformation, and the aspirations of the heart.
Third, devotion to repenting and confessing all transgressions, hiding nothing, rectifying the heart and cultivating reverence, ever fulfilling one’s duties.
Fourth, devotion to the aspiration for divine immortality, to behold the True Lord, to escape the calamitous world, and to witness the Great Peace in person.
Fifth, devotion to delivering all from suffering and hardship, from the Three Evil Paths and the Five Calamities.
Sixth, devotion to the aspiration to attain flight, to ride upon clouds and dragons.
Seventh, devotion to the billions of ancestors, the parents of past lives, to disperse the accumulated burdens of the deceased, to free them from servitude and punishment, and to ascend to the halls of felicity.
Eighth, devotion to all within the household, young and old, and to fellow practitioners, that their blessings and felicity daily increase, and their good thoughts daily arise.
Ninth, devotion to all people universally, to descendants of future generations, that they escape calamity and, dwelling in peril, attain safety.
Tenth, devotion to all creatures from livestock downward, to all breathing and wriggling beings, and to all that draw breath and possess vitality, that they universally receive kindness and grace, and are covered and protected by beneficent shade.
Eleventh, devotion to the aspiration to transcend worldly glory, to cast aside heterodox customs, deceitful flattery, falsehood, demonic spirits, and the arts of spectral and miscellaneous sorcery.
Twelfth, devotion to commanding ghosts and employing spirits, to capturing and restraining the wicked and deceitful, that heaven and humanity suffer no harm, and all universally part from evil, the Three Calamities, Nine Perils, Ten Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, to attain the rank of the highest immortals, ascend to heaven in broad daylight, and after transcending the immortal realm, unite with the Dao in devotion.

These twelve devotions arise from the natural heart of heaven, the virtue of great compassion, and their merit is vast throughout the heavens.

The old ritual system pertains to the Middle Chapter of the Numinous Treasure, located in the Mysterious Capital. The Middle Register of the Purple Tenuity Palace in the Mysterious Capital bestows twelve devotions, and with them come twelve rewards:

First, the body is sturdy and strong, the physical form peaceful and secure.
Second, one’s reputation spreads far and wide; all people desire to hear of one’s wishes.
Third, one is beloved and revered by all the great sacred honored gods of the heavens, the wondrously accomplished Perfected, favored by the sun, moon, and stars, revered by immortals and sages, looked up to by earth spirits, and feared by ghosts and gods.
Fourth, the myriad families of the world revere and honor one, calling one a Perfected; all is auspicious and without misfortune, and felicity and peace endure forever. All crawling creatures seek one as a bridge; the thousand spirits and myriad demons, the monstrous and deceitful ghosts and gods, all vanish in an instant, and every response follows the heart’s desire.
Fifth, wherever one goes, in coming and going, officials and soldiers guard the body, heavenly officers lead the way, and earth spirits receive and welcome.
Sixth, one subdues and commands all ghosts and gods of heaven and earth; one sits and summons the heavenly kitchens and jade maidens to attend and guard.
Seventh, one commands the Six Jia spirits, sets the stars in motion, rebukes and employs the Three August Ones, dispatches and commands ghosts and spirits; in walking and sitting, eating and resting, heavenly spirits attend and protect, and earth spirits stand guard.
Eighth, wherever one dwells, within a radius of three thousand six hundred li, the monstrous and deceitful, heterodox customs, and crafty specters all vanish in an instant.

Ninth, in associating with those on the Dao, one is lifted by immortals, roaming the Five Peaks; entering and leaving among the people, none dare harm or injure.
Tenth, one severs the heterodox and shatters enemies, commanding them to depart without instruction.
Eleventh, with each day, the bones of longevity grow, the Dao of immortality daily advances; when the Dao is perfected and virtue fulfilled, one ascends to heaven in broad daylight.
Twelfth, one befriends the supreme sages, the noble lords and elders, ascending into the formless and merging with the Dao as one.

These twelve rewards extend from the bestowal of virtue, prized by the Supreme Emperor, and naturally attained through focused intent. The two chapters of *Bestowing Thoughts and Receiving Rewards* contain twenty-four clauses, issued from the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mysterious Capital in the *Middle Prime Registers*—the virtue practiced by those who cultivate the utmost truth.

The *Lower Prime Registers* of the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mysterious Capital. The *True Writ of Numinous Treasure*, when observed by the assembled perfected ones in fasting and audience, reveals twelve graces upon paying homage to the celestial patterns:
First, it absolves the transgressions of past lives and the sins of the present.
Second, it brings fortune and averts calamity.
Third, it secures life in the future and averts death.
Fourth, it summons wealth and attracts official emolument.
Fifth, it benefits descendants in later generations.
Sixth, it extends blessings to departed ancestors.
Seventh, it ensures prosperity in the present life.
Eighth, it forges kinship with heaven and earth.
Ninth, it fosters friendship with perfected ones.
Tenth, one swiftly attains celestial immortality, ascending to heaven in broad daylight.
Eleventh, after transcending mortality, one ascends to the halls of the Dao.
Twelfth, it bestows universal blessings, serving as a bridge for the world.

These twelve graces arise from the refinement of conduct, where virtue moves the celestial perfected. The *Lower Prime Registers* of the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mysterious Capital. The *True Writ of Numinous Treasure*, when observed by the assembled perfected ones in fasting and audience, reveals fourteen merits:
First, for past lives; second, for descendants; third, for the present world; fourth, for dwelling in mountains; fifth, for cultivating the Dao; sixth, for seeking immortality; seventh, for officials; eighth, for governing the people; ninth, for all beings; tenth, for the world; eleventh, for heaven; twelfth, for spirits; thirteenth, for humanity; fourteenth, for all myriad things.

The method of fasting and directly addressing the supreme sages is one of purity, emptiness, simplicity, and plainness—casting off filth to summon the perfected. Above, it accords with the arrayed stars; in the middle, it aligns with human sentiments; below, it conforms to the hearts of things. The sagely see it as sagely, the benevolent as benevolent, the wise as wise, the worthy as worthy. The Primordial Beginning established this Dharma as the most revered of all Daoist practices, the abode of the Supreme Emperor, the bridge for those who cultivate and attain.

The two chapters of *Bestowing Grace and Establishing Merit* contain twenty-six clauses, issued from the *Lower Prime Registers* of the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mysterious Capital—the virtue practiced by those who cultivate the utmost truth.

The *Primordial Beginning’s Natural Vermilion Writ of Jade Chapters and True Writ*, after its revelation, was each entrusted with a text to pacify and guard the Five Peaks. The original text was sealed in the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Mysterious Capital, where the assembled perfected stood guard, establishing the arcane statutes with rites of reverence. At the end of the fifth kalpa, it was transmitted to the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Most High Great Sage Assembly, and the perfected ones of all heavens. They reverently cultivated the numinous writ, expounded its profound meanings, and elucidated its intricate details. There are ten divisions of wondrous scriptures in thirty-six scrolls, two scrolls of jade instructions to establish essential practices, all sealed in the Upper Palace of Purple Tenuity. The assembled perfected, on the days when heaven’s blessings converge, fast, uphold the precepts, gather in the Mysterious Capital, pay homage to the celestial patterns, recite the scriptures, and perform the Daoist rites. Above, they praise the chapters of the Primordial Beginning’s naturalness; in the middle, they harmonize the qi of the Three Primes’ luminous clarity; below, they celebrate the great compassionate teachings of the divine perfected.

Where the Dao resides, it is revered; only purity is prized, hence fasting and precepts preserve its discipline. On the days of fasting, the great sages, honored deities, and perfected ones of wondrous conduct, along with the sun, moon, and constellations, all gather at the Terrace of Jade Capital in the Upper Palace of Purple Tenuity in the Mysterious Capital. They uphold the precepts, pay homage, circumambulate, and recite the scriptures. The perfected ones and immortals of the Five Peaks on earth, the water emperors of the Four Seas, the Three Officials of Mount Feng, and the earth deities of the Three Realms—all spirits and numina, without exception, don their sashes, stand in solemnity, fast, revere the Dao, and honor the Dharma, thereby exalting the celestial perfected. The forms and standards of its rites and statutes are fully set forth in the *Golden and Purple Registers of the Numinous Treasure*, with systems of yin and yang, rewards, and assessments.

The *True Writ of Numinous Treasure* originated at the dawn of the Vermilion Clarity’s unfolding of the mysterious, named the *Vermilion Writ of the Radiant August Emperor of the Primordial Chaos*. When heaven and earth divided, heaven was called the *Numinous*, and earth the *Treasure*—hence the name *Numinous Treasure*. In the era of the Yellow Emperor, at the end of the fifth kalpa, the teachings descended to deliver those who attain the Dao, enabling them to ascend into the mysterious.
